indicate that heart attacks occur when area of plaque bursts, a clot forms over area and blood flow is abruptly blocked; find that dangerous plaque is soft and fragile, produces no symptoms, would not be seen as obstruction to blood flow and would be not be stented or bypassed in 70 to 80 percent of cases;
